page.title: 15LOCAL HEALTH CARE
page.content: IN BILLINGHAY THERE ARE TWO DOCTORS - DR KERR AND DR DUKE-COX. THEY HAVE FOUR DISPENSARY GIRLS - TWO TO ANSWER THE PHONE AND TWO TO MAKE MEDICINES. AT THE SURGERY THEY HAVE A MIDWIFE WHO COMES WEEKLY. IN JANUARY AND FEBRUARY MOST PEOPLE HAVE COUGHS, COLDS AND SORE THROATS. IN MARCH AND APRIL PEOPLE WILL BE GETTING RID OF THESE. AT THE BEGINNING OF JUNE AND THE END OF JULY PEOPLE WHO GET HAYFEVER WILL START TO GET IT. THE AREA IS ALSO SERVED BY TWO HOSPITALS WHICH DEAL WITH MORE SERIOUS CASES AND TO WHICH THE LOCAL DOCTORS CAN REFER PEOPLE. THEY ARE THE PILGRIM HOSPITAL BOSTON AND THE LINCOLN COUNTY HOSPITAL.
